review.title: “Great Company”
review.pros: Pros – Great workplace, smart people and diverse, awesome products.
review.cons: Cons – Company is being re-estrucutred but I prefer to see this fact as an opportunity.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.employee-type: Senior Manager- Global Education Services (Former Employee)
review.title: “Worked for LifeSize- a division of Logitech in Austin, TX”
review.pros: Pros – Great benefits, 50% off of all products, free food and drinks in the facility, great technology, fantastic HR department
review.cons: Cons – Philosophy changed dramatically throughout 3 years, disconnect between areas within the company- especially the US and EMEA.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – More transparency- especially when it comes to bonuses. A clearer and more consistent review process.

review.title: “On its way down...”
review.pros: Pros – Nice people. Generally social and positive employees.
review.cons: Cons – No leadership vision from company management. Widely regarded internally as an inevitably sinking ship. So the in-fighting has begun and the fun departed long ago.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Get some product programs which make sense. Since Google TV, the company has lost its design/r&d power.

review.title: “It's been a good run”
review.pros: Pros – Great company to work for consumer electronics space. Mid size.
review.cons: Cons – Work life balance can be better.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Exceptional Company Culture”
review.pros: Pros – I worked at Logitech until 2009. The company had a fantastic company culture - a blend of European and American values - that placed emphasis on the individual, but promoted a community atmosphere. The company had many bright and creative people who developed amazing products!
review.cons: Cons – Logitech, at that time, struggled with the ability to merge technologies and products across its many business units. Its mouse/keyboard, audio, camera, streaming music product groups worked independently - they didn't leverage each other's technologies or business plans.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Small Company, Innovative Products”
review.pros: Pros – The products that continue to come out of Logitech, especially supporting smart devices and iPads, are really top-notch. And whereas the company has gotten smaller over the years (downsizing), the innovation stays at the forefront of who they are.
review.cons: Cons – As companies downsize it becomes increasingly hard to invest in product categories. Logitech plays in many product categories and that means fewer dollars to spread around. Maybe it's time to shed some product lines and place your bets on the few that will see you into the future.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep innovating and reaching to do great work.

review.title: “Great company but changing”
review.pros: Pros – The product development process is great at getting alignment. The company constantly comes out with cool products -- products you are proud to show off at home to your friends, and a brand you are proud to represent.
review.cons: Cons – Innovation tempered by requirement of business case to sell volume in short term. Good ideas sometimes lost because resources and time to make it successful are not committed.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Fairly new at Logitech, but I really like it!”
review.pros: Pros – Been here almost a year, and I am very happy. Pros include working alongside really cool people in a flexible and casual work environment, with excellent benefits, and seemingly solid management that is trying really hard to steer the company in the right direction to long term stability and growth in a rapidly changing market (tablets/mobility and touchscreen are the future, PCs and mice going away, etc.).
review.cons: Cons – Company has been shrinking to consolidate and maintain itself longterm for a strong future, so there've been a few reorgs and layoffs in the past year or two that have left people feeling a bit demoralized.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Challenged company with still some good $ resources + old-fashioned management”
review.pros: Pros – "Win" attitude. Smart people (but many leaving...). Still quite a solid cash position giving some flexibility to make the right choices.
review.cons: Cons – Several old-fashioned Sr. executives accountable for Logitech challenged situation are still in the company. Many new executives from very large companies make things worse (affect agility). Some of them are just average in their positions. Rising superstars already left the company.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Retain top talents (top issue). Work-out a more solid turnaround strategy. Challenged core business requires more disruptive innovation in other areas + more risk-taking.

review.title: “Lots of changes but nothing that points to any growth or strategy”
review.pros: Pros – Logitech is a pretty easy place to work. Work hours are flexible, benefits are good, people are nice and the products are fun.
review.cons: Cons – There is a serious lack of employee engagement which can make getting things done difficult and frustrating. This might be because the strategy keeps on changing. Or it could be because there are rarely key decision makers defined. Every decision seems to be rethought and then changed from the bottom all the way to the top.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – You need to decide what type of company you want to be and then empower the correct employees to make it happen.

review.title: “Friendly but not focused on long-term sustainability”
review.pros: Pros – Nice place to work. Friendly people, cool products, and don't have to work too hard. Brand is truly known around the world and this is a big untapped asset that still has potential.
review.cons: Cons – the company is not growing, is slowing shrinking, and many entrenched middle-managers are resistant to change. Still a conflict/dysfunction between centralized functions and regionalized sales structure.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – stop believing your own aspirational goals and deal with the harsh reality of the market -- make the big cuts necessary to truly make the company long-term sustainable and stable.

review.title: “Great place to work, but struggling to find their way in the marketplace”
review.pros: Pros – Great group of people. Easy environment with good benefits. Maybe even too easy, as the results show.
review.cons: Cons – Struggling in the market. Sr Executive leadership is not inspirational.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Develop passion and push people.
review.recommended: – I'm not optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “A once great company struggling to re-define itself”
review.pros: Pros – The opportunity to work with talented product managers, designers and engineers who are extremely passionate about great product design. Logitech designs the best looking, feeling and functioning peripherals, bar none. This being said, to quote former CEO Guerrino De Luca "we are cooks not farmers." In other words, Logitech is good at marrying technologies with exquisite human interface. It is not particularly good at inventing new technologies.The company, traditionally, has been good at riding the waves though sometimes it gets there too early. Example: it invented Spotlight five years too early before broadband had reached critical mass. Five years later, YouTube came along at the right time.Logitech offers a highly multicultural work environment giving you the opportunity to work with interesting people from all over the world and travel to company sites across multiple continents (role dependent).Historically, the company treated its employees very well and morale was high. Though this has changed dramatically in recent years.
review.cons: Cons – Since the company has fallen on hard times in the past few years the employees have come to feel less and less like the company had their best interest in mind. As a result morale and employee loyalty have dropped significantly.While Logitech has designed and produced great products over the years, and has been good at catching waves, it typically has not been particularly good in developing new markets. Investment in marketing and brand development have been lacking.Management over the last 7 years focused on too many opportunities. As a result it missed the opportunity to focus on a select few at the right time.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – You've laid off enough people now. Presumably you have or are about to hit bottom. Pick a "couple" of opportunities and double down on them. If one of them is mobile music devices, which I believe it is, then you'll need to quadruple down on it as your competition is already investing tons and has been for years now.

review.title: “Director of Business Development”
review.pros: Pros – Logitech designs outstanding hardware peripherals for PCs and mobile platforms in terms of look, feel and function.Opportunity to work with very talented engineers and product managers.Chance to work in a highly multi-cultural environment both in the U.S. and sites worldwide.
review.cons: Cons – Logitech continues to go through hard times. Ongoing softness in the PC market has resulted in continued depressed sales of PC peripherals, Logitech's core business.As a result it has become a rather stressful place to work, especially owing to several rounds of layoffs which have occurred over the past year.Logitech tends to invest in products but not sufficiently in sustained marketing programs for market development or to compete effectively against entrenched players.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Remain laser focus and invest in marketing and brand building in growth businesses (e.g. wearable and portable devices for music; Logitech for Business). BTW, Guerrino De Luca is no longer the CEO. It's Bracken Darrell who took over in January of 2013. Hence my rating below refers to him, not Guerrino.

review.title: “Great work environment”
review.pros: Pros – very supportive management, good work-life balance, good benefits, highly competent co-workers, interesting projects,
review.cons: Cons – declining industry (PC accessories), Logitech has been struggling to find a new product line to take on the profitable big role that the declining mouse/keyboard business is beginning to leave
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – find the new "mouse". Take more risks, not so much with big investments, but with new technology.

review.title: “A good company at heart, but some serious transitional problems. Unstable. Beware.”
review.pros: Pros – Good Salary and Benefits, generally interesting work.
review.cons: Cons – Company is struggling to adapt to a market where PCs are second fiddle.They have a pretty disastrous marketing-based approach to developing new product, so be aware you are may be entirely beholden to some marketing person who dictates how you do your job. If that person is good, it's fine. If they suck, it can be a miserable slog dealing with someone who has a mediocre grasp of the product.In general, I do not see the company taking the steps necessary to survive and grow. After the google TV fiasco, they cut a lot of fat and are trying to re-entrench themselves in some core businesses--and add a new line of mobile products--but there are no long-term growth prospects in mice/keyboards/webcam/speakers/etc, because the PC market as a whole is evaporating (not to mention those are all commodity markets at this point). Company has a mobile initiative that is good, but too little, too late, IMO, and consistently hampered by people stuck in 2007. Lastly, some of the businesses they're divesting are--IMO--better opportunities for the company (in part because they are complimentary to mobile), but maybe there's some business logic there I don't follow.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Start acting like a startup. Start moving quickly. Realize--and act on the realization--that you cannot fall back on your existing markets. No amount of innovation is going to bring keyboards, mice and webcams back from the dead in a world of laptops and tablets.End your marketing driven approach, start making your engineers first-class citizens in the design of new product. The company marginalizes some of its brightest.

review.title: “Bully management getting in the way of new product development”
review.pros: Pros – Company has some excellent people with great ideas. New products, especially those in the new mobility area show great promise.
review.cons: Cons – However certain product groups neglect their primary focus of developing quality products within cost parameters and instead reach to other departments where they have no expertise and run havoc.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Show some backbone and get rid of power hungry product development heads and show the rest of the company that company performance comes ahead of personalities.

review.title: “A good company whose current direction is concerning.”
review.pros: Pros – Excellent benefits. Some really good people, both personally and professionally. Makes interesting products. Decent salary.
review.cons: Cons – Work/Life balance isn't great. Not as much of a meritocracy as it claims. Site management can be indecisive.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm not optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Work with very bright people in a very challenging turnaround situation”
review.pros: Pros – Work environment, benefits, collaborative atmosphere from a global perspective.
review.cons: Cons – HQ/Western Region relationship has historically been contentious, adversarial.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Be quicker to recognize the writing on the wall about dying categories. Focus less on churning out new iterations of mice/keyboards and more on game-changing mobile/audio products/services. Already starting to see moves in the right direction (finally got rid of Quindlen), but probably a bit too late.

review.title: “Nice place to work”
review.pros: Pros – Great company culture and overall environment. Got lots of opportunities to suggest and pursue projects, management is very flexible and progressive.
review.cons: Cons – Less aggressive in terms of business drive, need to onboard and attract smarter talent for pushing the limits even further. Salary should be somewhat higher than presently offerred.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Decent Company, Poor Managment”
review.pros: Pros – Pays well, relaxed company culture knows how to have fun, good amount of time off. Logitech excels in its core categories (mice, keyboards), it is just a shame that poor management is keeping it from truly innovating in other areas.
review.cons: Cons – Management is slow to make decisions which negatively impacts business. The company has made some bad bets and under-funded and promoted certain categories which it is now trying to sell off. Not sure how much longer the company can rely on selling mice and keyboards when we are now living in a touchscreen world.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Empower your working level people to make more decisions and react to changes in the market faster.

review.title: “Customer Account Manager”
review.pros: Pros – Growth opportunity, great products, friendly people. If you are ready to drive your career, this is the place to be.
review.cons: Cons – Declining PC market, role clarity
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Great products but company is mired in politics”
review.pros: Pros – Logitech has some of the most exciting computer peripheral products. The degree to which product quality is validated is worthy of mentioning. Company feels like a mini United Nations in many ways and has a very unique model of internal and outsourced production.
review.cons: Cons – This is a classic case of finding own worst enemy in themselves. The internal politics and regional (Europe vs US vs Asia) clashes took down what could have been a great company. Very unfortunate.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – There are some great minds in engineering and marketing but unless the silo mentality and internal politics can be resolved, Logitech will not be able to rise to the challenge of a diminishing market.

review.title: “Great benefits and good work/life balance, but if you are ambitious, look elsewhere”
review.pros: Pros – Great health benefits and lots of flexibility for a good work/life balance.
review.cons: Cons – Logitech is not sure what they want to be now that momentum has shifted to mobile and tablet use more so than PC. The bread and butter that was mice and keyboards is evaporating and Logitech cast a broad net over many opportunities, but spread itself too thin to really invest in growth areas. New CEO is attempting to turn the behemoth of a company (which is not appropriate for it's actual size) around.Lots of red tape, lots and lots of beaurocracy and no accountability.All in all, Logitech is VERY old school.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Drive accountability down through the organization and better develop your talent.

review.title: “Needs to Change Faster”
review.pros: Pros – Recognizes that it has problems.
review.cons: Cons – Not addressing them fast enough.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Cut more of the fat at the top who have failed the company over and over.

review.title: “Logitech - Management Failures Part of the Culture”
review.pros: Pros – Lots of freedom, plenty of spare time, work life balance is decent, colleagues are nice. bring your own phone and flexible desktop support.
review.cons: Cons – Lack of focus from the management, total lack of vision on future of computing industries in general, and price points way out of sync with the market.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Get some fresh blood in sales and marketing and stop blaming every other department for the failures.

review.title: “Don't work in the region if you are a woman or in marketing”
review.pros: Pros – Great products. Above average compensation.
review.cons: Cons – Good old boys club ,especially in salesStyle is more important than substance to manythe role of marketing is to be the punching bag of sales when they don't make their numberBad executive hire made the culture toxic
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Walk the walk... if you say that you care about employees, act like it

review.title: “Great products, but not the same Logitech.”
review.pros: Pros – Great culture and fun working with cool tech products that people use and want.
review.cons: Cons – Lack of internal promotions/salary increases, two mass layoff's in past three years, constantly changing Management all signs of a struggling company in today's market. Lots of good people are leaving to other companies.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Employees should be treated and rewarded better !

review.title: “Logitech”
review.pros: Pros – Great people to work with.
review.cons: Cons – Leadership is old school and not innovative.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Retire some of the older VPs and bring in fresh ideas.

review.title: “Good company, but too much bureaucracy and petty politics”
review.pros: Pros – Good benefits, fairly good perks, cool products to play with, a great work/life balance and lots of fun - the Hallowe'en festivities at Logitech are among the best I've ever seen. The current CEO, Guerrino De Luca, came out of retirement to help out the company and he is very good.
review.cons: Cons – Salaries are on the low side. Way too much inter-departmental politics and clique-building. Management doesn't seem to have much of a direction (though with Guerrino's return, that problem will probably lessen) and there are too many middle managers. There is also too much nepotism.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Cut middle management by at least fifty percent. Get rid of some of the too-numerous product lines. Are you a business accessories company or are you trying to compete with Sony/Samsung/Panasonic/etc? Consolidate and figure out what kind of company you want to be and what kinds of products you're trying to sell.

review.title: “A company in search of stability”
review.pros: Pros – good benefits, work/life balance, everyone is courteous
review.cons: Cons – It is a culture of passive aggressive back-stabbing, executives who are out of touch with markets and their own company and not willing to learn. It has been milking the mouse for a very long time, and doesn't have an innovation engine to discover new ideas and get them to market in a timely fashion. The cycle of bloating with bureaucracy and then layoff is unsustainable. It drives people to safe roles, safe initiatives, and risk aversion.
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend – I'm not optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “It's fun to develop & launch consumer electronic devices.”
review.pros: Pros – Product Development process is well documented online.
review.cons: Cons – Need to get back to namebrand identity with less workers from tough downsizing.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Don't cut the critical job functions because the gaps will be wider, and more people will be de-motivated and feel lost.

review.title: “CHAOS”
review.pros: Pros – It is a job but not a secure one
review.cons: Cons – I dont know where to start.The management needs help...A LOT...all work seems to be dumped on some individuals and then those are usually the first ones to go
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – DO YOUR JOB! Stop putting people in charge that can not handle it...

review.title: “In transition”
review.pros: Pros – Great work/life balance. Good people and environment.
review.cons: Cons – Poor company morale. Not a lot of advancement within company. Employees seem to not care.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Need to provide career paths to attract and retain talent. Improve company morale and commitment by employees.

review.title: “Idiot Swiss French”

review.cons: Cons – If you aren't Swiss-French you have no future in the company...and on top of that, the Swiss-French are total idiots. So, be ready for a lot of stupidity working there....they seem to like it that way.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Hire Swiss French folks only, don't torture the rest of us you nationalistic jerks!

review.title: “Some cool products. Just an 'ok' place to work for the bay area. Work/life balance depends on which BU you're in.”
review.pros: Pros – Good products, generally keeping ahead of the market in most business units (but only just)Trying to do agileNow in a new building in Newark which is night and day better than the old placeReasonable perks - gym, discount on products, free coffee etc..
review.cons: Cons – Mismanagement in recent years, layoffs, senior turnover, uncertainty. New CEO has good fundamentals but doesn't get the tech industry.Risk averse management, especially with software investments (admittedly badly burned by the Google TV product).Very little long term product vision.Way too much done in India, higher risk and less control.Weak engineering management resulting in outdated software and infrastructure.Ridiculous hours asked of employees in working with India offices. Constant 20 x 7 fire drillsUseless HR department and terrible medical options (Cigna have the doctors no other providers want)
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Improve core software engineering and product management practices that enable India to function more autonomously.Look at getting revenue from software services as well as hardware, particularly in Digital Home and Music BUs otherwise the company will slowly die.

review.title: “Executives need to go”
review.pros: Pros – - good products- willing to spend on system, softwares
review.cons: Cons – - no vision, no leadership from upper management- no accountability- focus on scholars hiring instead of real life experience- performance is not based on merits
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – - check out the management's accomplishment - are they really worth retaining? Did you ever question why the recent restructuring wiping out entire departments after all, Logitech spent so much to implement?- Hold your management responsible for wasting money on retrenchment (they hired, terminated, then hired another bunch back), and on failed projects (this could be system projects as well)- stop hiring & Promoting relatives and friends that have absolutely no merits to the jobs

review.title: “Good place to work before the Great Recession”
review.pros: Pros – Logitech has good benefits and reasonably enlightened management. Halloween was always a big deal, lots of fun. I'd definitely go back if I had a chance.
review.cons: Cons – Logitech has not proven that it is nimble enough to recover from the explosion of tablet computing and smartphones, which don't need much in the way of peripherals. Google TV was a huge mistake.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – The company may need to shrink even more drastically to stay afloat.

review.title: “Where is this company heading?”
review.pros: Pros – Overbloated salaries to senior managers and low ranking managers alike!
review.cons: Cons – Small minded senior execs, unable to see the big picture, too uneducated to understand basic market principals at the MBA level. Execs steal other employees ideas to label as own, and this is integrated into a unhealthy 'company culture'.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Start with mission,vision,goals. Define and reward leadership skills and stop rewarding cowardice and thieves in a frat boy environment. The basic principals of business ought to include putting customers,shareholders,employees first...or is that only for leading edge silicon valley innovative companies to abide by and honor?

review.title: “Great, unforgettable experience. Got me to the next level”
review.pros: Pros – Culture of Great PeopleGreat ExperienceGood ProductsA Somewhat Cool Factor
review.cons: Cons – Products lacking the wow factorLack on innovation internallyHave become the market followers instead of the market leadersToo many sub par productsExecutive management fails slowly
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Get it together, get some cajones and make change.Be innovative, creativeGet the marketing organization organized

review.title: “Nice people, good work and life balance, but falling stock prices, and happy work environment”
review.pros: Pros – Nice peopleDemocratic decision processGood work life balanceMoving toward Mac platform
review.cons: Cons – slow decision processsenior management seems to be out of refreshing ideas
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – let the lower ranked employees that's in the trenches make the small decisions. a BU VP should not be involved with product features discussions...

review.title: “Very average experience, below market pay, no development or advancement”
review.pros: Pros – Good exposure to different areas of the business. Small company with tight knit feel. Very social workplace and environment. Strong market leadership position.
review.cons: Cons – Extremely overfocused on hitting quarterly revenue numbers at the expense of long range strategy and development. Below market pay and benefits. Limited learning and advancement.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Need to find a way to keep talent and reward strong employees to stop current brain drain. Need to limit rat race like focus on quarterly numbers and drive medium and long term goals.

review.title: “Don't work here if you are looking for fast paced environment and career advancement”
review.pros: Pros – - Great work/life balance.- Nice people with a family feel.- Great Logitech discount if you buy a lot of their products.
review.cons: Cons – - Management is old school and is not open to changes.- Most employees have been with the company for a long time, so they are just not motivated and unwilling to change.- Company rarely promotes people from within.- Old buildings and no nice perks to work here.- Horrible HR. I have no idea what their HR does all day. When I was hiring candidates for my Department, I had to call the candidates themselves for the initial screening.- There's no incentive to work hard. You will get the same bonus and pay increase as everyone else even if you work your butt off.- Duplicate Management roles and departments.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Need to let go of the old school upper Management, especially the ones with duplicate roles.

review.title: “Was good at the begining, but degradated later”
review.pros: Pros – World known company. Good benefits. Interesting job. job require broad experience.
review.cons: Cons – Company has serious management problems.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – One engineer has approximately five managers. Usually, managers has low qualification and insufficient education, and unable to perform there job. Some managers does not respect employees. Management attempt to keep employyes opinion inside of deprtment.

review.title: “Overall, decent place to work”
review.pros: Pros – Good salary and benefits, generally fun products, interesting work. Overall, a decent place to work.
review.cons: Cons – Company struggling to do software "right." Not good at managing hardware/software releases. Fragmented products. A fair amount of political and corporate posturing to climb various ladders.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Stop pretending that making a keyboard is the same as writing software and you can apply the same processes to either. Stop gating physical product launches on software. Understand that Logitech will increasingly be a "software" company, because these days good hardware needs great software to have any possibility of market success.

review.title: “Good work environment”
review.pros: Pros – High energy, extreme focus on results
review.cons: Cons – poor communication between departments at ground level

review.title: “Just like a big blue-chip - adjust your expectations!”
review.pros: Pros – Good work-life balanceIntelligent, knowledgeable people to work with
review.cons: Cons – Management not always qualifiedTop-down approach
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Please don't pretend to be interested in ideas from employees if you aren't going to really empower them to make improvements. If you want more of the same - admit it....

review.title: “Great company to work for!”
review.pros: Pros – Logitech has a wonderfully positive environment, where the employees sincerely care about the products and company. In addition, one has a feeling of their responsibilities and valued contribution. The work-life balance is definitely another positive, where managers and peers respect one's daily priorities.
review.cons: Cons – - Projects not always well defined or thought out from the beginning (though are usually successful)- Fremont location is not the prettiest for a larger-well known corporation.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – - Define expectations a better- Help with career planning and advancement- Provide more insight to opportunities within the company and company resources

review.title: “Overall great place to work at.”
review.pros: Pros – Great co workersFun EnvironmentGreat payHolidays are a big event at logitech.
review.cons: Cons – Some employees can be immature and have others cover their shift. Managers tend to only higher employees that have a degree in business. At times the V.P. can make you feel lower than other employees.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Overall I believe what the managers are doing at logitech are productive.

review.title: “Great direction, misguided paths..”
review.pros: Pros – Great benefits, decent corporate culture. Great products.
review.cons: Cons – Low salary increases yearly, too many organizational changes on a regular basis.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – The long-term goals Logitech has are good -- but the steps to get there aren't. Stop stepping on your technical customer base just to improve the footprint of your 'general' customer base.

review.title: “OK place to work”
review.pros: Pros – Cool people, cool technology, relaxed environment on a personal level
review.cons: Cons – decisions made my management take a long time to complete.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – More communication is needed to the internal employees about company decisions.

review.title: “Logitech is OK”
review.pros: Pros – Cutting edge technologyImplement and use products they makeglobal presence and opportunities to work with others outside the US
review.cons: Cons – High rate of organizational change without middle management inputSalary is a bit lowTravel and Education benefits are non-existent except to senior management
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Invest in your employees, reduce the organizational change, seek advice from your frontline management. Understanding that decisions cannot be made with too many inputs the level of input solicited is very low.

review.title: “Poor management, good people.”
review.pros: Pros – There are many employees that are very friendly, very helpful, very competent. The staff is full of potential and untapped skill.
review.cons: Cons – The staff is overworked and loosing hope. We've seen people cry during meetings because of stress and being bullied into unobtainable goals.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Clarify objectives and offer support to teams instead of placing the blame on your upper management. Stand up for your team and their efforts.

review.title: “A small star in the high tech space”
review.pros: Pros – Well managed company from Finance to Product StrategyGreat environment for capable and ambitious peopleSmall yet global company feel

review.title: “Great location, not so bad pay, leadership is sub par...”
review.pros: Pros – Many people here are nice and relatively genuine. Many also value hard work. The compensation isn't really bad all things considered. The products marketed are fabulous.
review.cons: Cons – Competency in management is a hit or miss. There are a lot of silos. The internal database infrastructure is messed up! No central administration hub for all the darn databases that exist. It's very difficult to find what you need. Some of the process, specifically those dealing with procurement are really ridiculous and cumbersome. Overall, clear communication from management down to the subordinates is not very good...lacks quite a bit of attention.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Take some courses on how to motivate your team and harness good skills. Build a backbone for getting rid of ineffective people!

review.title: “Very good place to work.”
review.pros: Pros – Respect for work life balance.
review.cons: Cons – There is a bias to hire from the outside or hire consultants instead of developing or utilizing internal capability. This may not be unusual, but it can be distracting. Also, there is a huge variability in management styles from group to group.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – If you are going to say "our biggest asset is our people" TREAT them like that.

review.title: “Great products and team support, poor automation and databases”
review.pros: Pros – Great products with good partners. Clear goals on programs. Clear goals on the key products for the year. Benefits are include a stock program. Logitech is a good corporate citizen supporting charitable causes. Community spirit for holidays and celebrating accomplishments. Teams are supportive and help each other. The products are very good and sleek. There are clear owners for most functions.
review.cons: Cons – Database are lacking. The dependence on Lotus Notes created Notes only databases. You spend an inordinate amount of time searching for information and posting in various documents, spreadsheets, and emails. This means most people spend their days just doing updates and posting rather than looking for opportunities and forward thinking.Logitech has bought several companies, but the consolidation process is very fragmented. Senior management allows the bought company to continue business without complying with the Logitech systems and brand. There is no firm schedule and no enforcement with consequences.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – It is time to get some real databases and get off Lotus Notes.Companies bought by Logitech need to be in Logitech systems and online in less than 6 months and senior management has to make it happen.

review.title: “Great company but not anymore...”
review.pros: Pros – Company had a great can do spirit. Made fun products that were sexy and funtional. Hardware Engineering especially industrial design is a core competency. Have a loyal following of users. Global company with a european flair. Good coffee!
review.cons: Cons – New management does not espouse the same spirit de core. People are less motivated then they were with previous CEO. New management does not incite the same passions.Headed downhil in many ways, sorry to say....
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Get the hell of of there and let someone who knows what they are doing and is passionate about it take over.

review.title: “Fun Place to work”
review.pros: Pros – Great products and feels like a family. Many people even hang out together outside of work. Had a support management of my schedule and gave me some freedom in my responsibilities. When communicating with upper management, the response was positive and really heard.
review.cons: Cons – Not very good communication from upper management.As with large corporation, its difficult to change things. Once a process is in, no one wants to "ruffle the feathers".Benefits are average if not on the low side.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Have all managers meet with their employees somewhat regularly. Hard to know exactly what is going on a lot of times. Slow down some of the product launches. Barely have time to learn from the past mistakes to change future product launches.

review.title: “Work Hard and try to free up enough time to Play Hard”
review.pros: Pros – Discounts on the items produced is nice, profit sharing is also a nice thing. I like working here because our group has relative freedom to implement things the way that make the most sense. It is nice being able to get things done and get good feedback about a job well done.
review.cons: Cons – Very windows oriented in an environment that is shifting more and more to other platforms, we could easily fill better niches with our offerings, but we don't. Also there seems to be a lot of movement inside of our BU, people leaving and being replaced. Politics are also a pretty huge problem. Meetings, meetings, meetings. But that is corp life it seems!
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Although each BU being an island may be useful, we are suffering from not sharing with each other. Also taking 3+ weeks to get items through the mail room is horrible.

review.title: “Logitech - A good place and getting better.”
review.pros: Pros – Logitech is a great company. It's growing quickly which can cause some pain points, but overall the company is working to address those issues. There are great benefits and a flexible schedule (depending on your department and manager). There are many opportunities within the company including travel and living abroad. Profit sharing, stock purchase programs, and nice vacation schedules round out the offering of goodies.
review.cons: Cons – There is an overall lack of communication between the higher level execs and the day-to-day workers. There are also some "managers" that shouldn't be managing people at all. I don't think there's a clear path to the career step and that hurts the company sometimes.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – SPEAK!

review.title: “Good company, great people and products”
review.pros: Pros – Lots of opportunities to be involved in making great products, having international business experience and chances to travel around the world - also great set of people to work with
review.cons: Cons – Too many office politics, fair to poor HR system for best match up of employees to roles in the company - also poor succession planning and ad hoc promotions of staff make it hard to understand what's needed to get promoted and success in the company
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – More focus is needed on developing people and getting them more engaged in their jobs. There are a lot of new ideas and a lot of passion that we are not tapping into as a company and as managers/directors/VPs

review.title: “Not bad, but could be better”
review.pros: Pros – Good benefits- 401k match, quarterly profit sharing, espp and 4 weeks of pto to start. Depending on the department you are working for, seems like a family friendly company. Willing to accomidate schedules and allow flexible hours and working from home.
review.cons: Cons – Seems the bigger the company gets, the more inefficient it gets. Too much politics sometimes and tasks are done just for the sake of doing them. Also, as the company gets bigger, the work increases and more and more is piled on top of employees, but no additional headcount is added. Also, the annual pay raises are very low. Even for high performing individuals, the percentage is not even 5%. Not much incentive to really meet all the goals assigned.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Get back to basics on how it used to be. Stop being so stingy and be open to hiring more people. Soon good employees will get burnt out and start leaving.

review.title: “overall great company”
review.pros: Pros – great benefits, profit sharing, consecutive growth.
review.cons: Cons – in mechanical engineering, you have to travel overseas a lot and deal with problems related from offshore division. Offshore asian engineers have different mentality compared to the state. When you travel to taiwan or china, you expect to work a lot of hours and get the job done. There is constant communication problem between US and offshore engineers. You may have a design review at offshore site. You are the only person travel from the US and tons of asian engineers sitting in the conference room critique your design. It is not a good ad easy relationship. Product development time line is really short. One project is about 9 months. It started in sept, by march of next year, you better al nail down the issues, because validation coming up next few months, then production in summer and ready to ship worldwide for december holiday season distribution.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – there are political conflict between employees in the us and offshore

review.title: “Loved working there, but........”
review.pros: Pros – the products, the people and their passion. The global nature of the company mean that you can work anywhere in the world.
review.cons: Cons – Some of the senior management need to go. The Regions need to be pulled back into line, especially the America's region - what a joke! To many people promoted without the necessary skills and experience. Some senior managers cannot make a decision and have abdicated all decision making to the Regions - which only makes it more vague and complex in terms of who does what. To many senior manager decision are not backed up with actions - it's a "we want this to change, now you figure it out' mentality.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Man up! Support your CEO! Start firing dead wood and pull the regions back into line. Get some ROI into your decision making. Find someone with a marketing background to run your marketing org, back up your words with actions. Stop thinking rank and file will fix things - there are to many old timers that don't want things to change so it is up to YOU to make it happen.

review.title: “Nice benefits, people, and pay, but insufficient planning, staffing, and communication.”
review.pros: Pros – The people are nice, the benefits and pay are adequate, the products are excellent, and schedules for most positions are flexible (and often include telecommuting).
review.cons: Cons – The company's downfall is a combination of inadequate communication, too little training and direction, unreasonable deadlines, lack of adequate planning and resource allocation, and excessive workloads due to insufficient staffing. The company often acts without fully considering execution which creates a stressful and frustrating work environment for its already overloaded employees. Logitech is a fast-growing company that is buckling at the seams. Though likely to continue its economic growth, it will suffer as an organization if does not realize the value of its employees and act accordingly.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Increased staffing goes hand-in-hand with growing a company.

review.title: “Going downhill”

If you can ignore most of the senior management, it would be a great place to work.
review.cons: Cons – Management disconnected from realityAll R & D is tied to products with ship dates already set. Nobody is willing to take a chance on researching something that may delay that.Lack of connection between performance and recognition / respect / payNo direction or feedback from management when projects begin turns into obsessive micromanagement when projects near the finish line.Overall the management strategy seems to be:1- delay making any decisions, and finally abdicate all responsibility when the project risks being cancelled.2- swoop in months later and complain that the project lacks proper direction.3 - micromanage until the project is actually in jeopardy.4 - blame your team because after all, you've abidcated all of your responsibilites.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – The harder you try to micromanage, the worse you make things. Step back and let good people do good work.

review.cons: Cons – No downsides, except the fact that we are all very busy. Competition is tough and it keeps the team very active.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep doing the same great job, pushing company towards growth and keeping the team motivated for success.

review.title: “It's been over a year, and I still feel relieved to be out of there...”
review.pros: Pros – My pay was decent. The profit-sharing bonuses were nice too.
review.cons: Cons – In my department, there was a pervasive lack of professionalism. I did not trust my supervisor or upper management. The longer I worked there, the more unethical behavior I saw. They gossiped, played favorites, openly mocked and ridiculed non-click employees, and found ways to punish you if didn't support whatever they did and said. The office was dirty and unkept. They used antiquated, beat-up office furniture, and you had to walk around boxes and junk piled up in every available hallway, nook, and cranny. Their refrigerators were antiquated and rarely cleaned (pew), and they didn't even replace the handles that apparently fell off way back when.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – The only senior management I ever saw was the CEO, Guerrino De Luca, and that was because he was always standing outside his building smoking cigarettes. He never smiled or spoke when I walked by--not that I minded. He struck me as a non-people type, a strategist completely focused on stock price and the like.

review.title: “Excellent products but dissapointing team leadership”
review.pros: Pros – Flexible working hours but also means flexing the working time beyond normal working hours daily including Saturdays, Sundays, and public holidays. When you tell people you work at Logitech, they know where you work, and respect the products. Being a small division of Logitech, everyone gets some exposure to what will likely become award winning products when these products are still in the earliest design stages. Being a company that creates consumer computer peripherals and other electronics, you see your work reviewed publicly by the media, through customer reviews on sites and forums such as lowyat.net. A resume that shows a reasonable amount of time at Logitech is likely to anyone's career -- It has definitely helped mine post Logitech.
review.cons: Cons – The politics and lack of empowerment.The Kuala Lumpur (HQ) office is an incredibly political environment, in the negative sense of the word. Very little seems to get done through the well publicized processes, but rather anything accomplished is done through political machinations, and verbally sabotaging other projects with senior management to get resources for your own project.It is a very stressful environment, where immediate turn around is expected on complex work, and "No response & Approved via email but later denies all allegations" are not acceptable at all. Work life balance is not a consideration -- work is expected to come first, at all times of the day, including Saturdays, Sundays, Public Holidays, Medical Leave and even during your once a year Chinese New Year official leave. Yet, you are expected to feel privileged for being given the opportunity to work at Logitech.Project management in the development area is almost non-existant, and is focused more on presenting what senior management wants to hear, and in this case they are expecting you to fulfil 100% of the ops target regardless of the reasons you provide. A few years ago this division was very diplomatic centric, and has an excellent leadership. New young management was brought in to take the team lead despite irrelevant working experience and they gave the new guy complete say over everything, but did not hire, nor train product managers to assume this role.Overall this is a very stressful place to work, and it takes a special person who knows how to work a corrupt system and who has a thick skin in the face of political attacks to succeed here.Very late response and support for communication, event planning, marketing, while sales target are reviewed quarterly with impossible numbers to achieve.
